intro: Duperreya sericea, commonly known as silverleaf duperreya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Duperreya sericea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
